Content: I'm only a few pages in, but it is already clear that the author is not a native English speaker and that the publisher didn't have much of a hand in editing it.. The first sentence is "Only by making a place in our mobile device can mobile app development emphasize our brand name." Does this mean "To be popular, you need a mobile app"?. Still on page 1: "Flutter and Dart are two app development technologies that can meet your requirements. We may compare the features and benefits of both frameworks and then make an informed decision on which framework would best suit our app concept." This implies that we are going to choose between Flutter and Dart—but only Flutter is a framework and it is built on Dart (a language, not a framework).. Page 2: "in definition, creating a mobile application is a time-consuming and difficult task." What does "In definition" add to that sentence? I assume the author meant "By definition," but there isn't anything about the definition of a mobile application that makes it time-consuming or difficult.. Page 3: "The Flutter app is written in the Dart programming language, which employs JIT (Just-in-Time) and AOT (Ahead-of-Time) compilation to increase [sic] total start-up time." Compiling should _decrease_ (not increase) total start-up time.. I selected this book to use as a college textbook because I hoped that its recent publication implied that it would cover more of the recent features. But in its description of Flutter's history (page 4), we are told that "On October 24, 2019, the framework's current stable release was Flutter v1.9.1+hotfix.6." This book has a 2023 copyright and as of April 20, 2023, Flutter v3.7.12 is available. So, it is both out-of-date and poorly written.

Content: Looking for a book about Flutter and Dart I chose this one primarily for the publication date. The subject is rather new and changing rapidly. I'll have to admit I was a bit worried about the proof reading on this ebook when the first page announced that it would have an Introduction to Fart! I am sure that F was meant to be a D since Flutter uses the Dart programming language. Now I've only reached page 20 at this point but it seems my fears were mistaken because the proof reader seems to have been awake ever since that first typo. I will certainly come back to revise the 4 star rating if I'm disappointed after getting further into the book, but early on it looks good.

Name: Nelson V.
Content: In case you're confused on the headline, I decided to do a TUF Gaming build. Now this isn't an original idea, but when I went poking around to do a new build, its something I came up with on my own... initially.. So when I went around the internet forums looking for ideas, I came across a video build of the ASUS TUF variety. This person was building a rig that housed almost ALL ASUS branded hardware. This piqued my interest, so I went around collecting all the goodies, including this ram.. The T-Force ram group is new to me, since i'm coming from corsair and gskill. But I wanted to stay as true to the TUF theme as possible, and the video had these listed so I gave it a shot. The qvl ASUS has for the TUF Gaming X570 pro WIFI II doesn't list these, so bear that in mind if you're not going to bend in that regard.. Moving on.... Install is straight forward and simple, you can only install it 1 way. The other way breaks the ram or ram slot, so don't do that. They are of the same dimensions as your typical stick of ram, with the typical rgb lighting in the typical spot.. Heatsinks are good, nothing was peeling off when I examined them for any obvious defects. Overall, your typical ram.. RGB however, was a different story. And its also why I subtracted a star for stability. As of this writing, they're behaving with the aura sync software provided by ASUS and supposedly supported by T-Force.. What's happening, is when a rgb theme is loaded up (starry night in ASUS armor crate, check it out), it'll run like it's supposed to. However after a few hours, or a day, i'll notice that one of the ram sticks has locked itself on 2 colors and nothing else. No movement of color, no fade, no nothing. And just one stick, not the other. Now i'm not sure if its the rgb, or the software. There's no way to test rgb unfortunately. I'm going to assume and say its the software because i reinstalled the armor crate which the aura sync runs under, and for the time being that stick of ram is behaving. But that could change.. Anyhow, I have 2 sticks slotted into that ASUS TUF X570 pro I mentioned, supporting a ryzen 7 5800x and having no issues. For you gamers, i've run Star Citizen at max settings, and you number crunchers I run World Community Grid and i'm cranking out completed tasks. Both of these are accomplished with zero lag while doing other tasks on the pc (youtube, newsfeeds, etc etc). No, the ram is not overclocked. I'll tinker with memclocks and voltages when winter rolls around and everything shuts down (I live in the north, snow sucks).. In the end, buy with confidence. I took a chance on another brand and for now, its paying off. Good luck on your build!

Content: This book is fantastic in my opinion because it offered a review of the neurobiology of specific symptoms of depression, which is helpful as a starting point for researching transdiagnostic symptoms. It also did not suffer from dogmatic thinking that plagues many research domains(i.e. OCD research), which is evidenced by the review of psychostimulant therapy in bipolar mania; this is a paradoxical but empirically supported notion that is frequently not mentioned in other sources.
Product Title: Systems Neuroscience in Depression

Name: Alex
Content: I've read this front to back more then once and annotated every page. It's really up to date and does not dogmatically drone on and on about monoamines like many other books. The writing on that enzyme indolamine 2,3 dioxygenase and quinolinic acid were my favorite part.. I'm an undergrad studying cell and molec bio with an emphasis on neuroscience and have used this for a class project in the past and will use it again as a reference in the future. I have severe refractory MDD and this book has helped me seek more novel and translational treatments with my MDs and that has helped me very much. More then anything I just found this book really fun to read and not like a textbook so much. Love the translational implications and neuroimmune stuff in here. I'm use to so much monoamine dogma so this book is a breath of fresh air.
Product Title: Systems Neuroscience in Depression

Content: I really wanted to like this book but quite frankly, it is a coffee table book. Glossy pages with small print can be difficult to see and the glossy pastel colors do not help matters either. The TOC is a black background with white letters. Entirely poor use of color in the book as far as something designed to teach. As mentioned, more of a coffee table book.. Appears to be good knowledge in the book but if you already have a host or have experience in the internet world you can cut out the first 36 pages and go to chapter 5. I did, I even cut off the front and back covers to make using the book much easier. Information is presented in too wordy of a format. What can take two lines to explain ends up taking one or two paragraphs. I almost felt like a 5 year being taught wash his hands.. I gave up on the book at the end of chapter 5 and tossed it into the trash. If you need a coffee table book, then this is the one to buy. If you need something that actually tosses a lot of meat and potatoes knowledge at you in a concise manner and does it on paper that you can actually write on, then look to purchase a different book.

Name: Fred Sabin
Content: Create your own Website using Wordpress In a Weekend. Focal Press / Taylor and Francis Group. Copyright © 2013 The Ilex Press Ltd.. ISBN: 978-0-415-66268-0 (pbk). Fred Sabin (President, New Jersey Computer Club) Review - September 9, 2013. The New Jersey Computer Club (NJCC) is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to educating the public about computer systems, software, and their uses; providing community service to charities and educational groups; and sharing knowledge and social activities with other computer enthusiasts. A frequent topic of discussion is how to create and upgrade websites. In my opinion, this book is well written and a comprehensive reference on everything associated with this topic (using Wordpress).. There are numerous software programs and other tools available for creating a website. Unfortunately, many are either very simple (fill in the blanks) that limit creativity, or complex requiring a knowledge of HTML or another programming aid. This book is a welcome compromise that combines step by step instructions, with explanations on what you are doing and how to alter it for upgrades or additional modifications. It would be especially useful for small business applications with a limited budget, and would integrate well into a business plan to help define your business purpose, focus, and marketing components.. I did find the book title of "in a weekend" misleading in that the "what you will need in advance" (domain name, hosting, professional photographs, logo, legal issues, PayPal, etc.) combined with "creating a website" activities may require time commitments over many days to complete. Fortunately, the well presented detailed instructions and extensive references will allow the creation of an excellent website without the need to search for additional information. In fact, the well organized references make this book an excellent source to upgrade or modify any existing website.. This is a book that you could skim through in a couple of hours (leaving out the details) to get an excellent grasp of the versatility of websites; a learning tool to gain specific knowledge about an area of website interest; or a technical reference to find detailed information on a specific website component. To properly use the book to create a professional website, however, will probably take many hours over many days, but you will gain an excellent understanding of your final product and will be able to make improvements to it when necessary.. I would therefore recommend "Create your own Website using Wordpress (in a weekend)" to our NJCC membership and others as a self help tool for creating or modifying a website.

Name: B. Morrison
Content: Even if you are a technophobe, this book will take you by the hand and help you get your website up in no time.. I bought this book a year after failing to design a website using the "WordPress for Dummies" book. I'm a graphic designer who specializes in print, and had been dreading the thought of learning WordPress in order to redesign my portfolio website. After getting nowhere with the Dummies book, I purchased this one and had a preliminary site up within 24 hours.. The book walks you through every step--from selecting a domain name and hosting plan to purchasing themes and stock images. There are even sections about growing your audience and legal issues. Alannah Moore's writing style is clear, and free of off-putting technobabble.. Whats more--the layout is beautiful and really user friendly. There are lots of example images and tip boxes. I found myself flipping through the book just for fun!
Product Title: Create Your Own Website (Using Wordpress) in a Weekend

Name: Elzi Hunter
Content: I have had my wordpress website up for a year, but I have not always been able to make quick changes without resorting to calling my website designer or techie friends for help. With 'Create Your Website,' I was able to quickly tab through the correctly labelled table of contents to find what I needed. I have added video to my website and now know how to add PayPal buttons - WITHOUT having to pay for hours of development time or wait until someone can help me.. This book empowered me to do a lot of things on my own - quickly and easily, without frustration. I have saved money and now have a flexible website. I can change things as I see fit, when I see fit.. Whether you are a novice creating your first website or a little more advanced but searching for specialized tips on beefing up your website, growing your audience or making quick modifications, this book is a must-have on your bookshelf.
Product Title: Create Your Own Website (Using Wordpress) in a Weekend

Name: languido
Content: There were 15 beginners Wordpress books at my local bookstore, and this one stood out from the rest because it is beautifully designed and a pleasure to look at. The information is presented very clearly, with photographs and screenshots illustrating every single step of the way, while also anticipating questions you may have. It's fairly short--160 pages--made shorter by the fact that every page is taken up by screenshots of what you will see on your computer. I bought it yesterday, Friday, afternoon, and my first Wordpress website is already halfway done today, Saturday midday. I have no doubt I will finish it this weekend!. The commenter who subtracted a star because some basic ingredients --like a photograph--were required is being unrealistic. Nobody can teach you how to cook a three course meal in five minutes if you don't have any food in your kitchen. And even if you don't have any ingredients, the author gives you links to websites where you can quickly download them for free.
